Name.label: Multiple congenital anomalies/dysmorphic syndrome without intellectual disability
Genetic multiple congenital anomalies/dysmorphic syndrome without intellectual disability

TextSection.Contents: Lethal congenital contracture syndrome type 2 is a rare arthrogryposis syndrome characterized by multiple congenital contactures (typically extended elbows and flexed knees), micrognathia, anterior horn cell degeneration, skeletal muscle atrophy (mainly in the lower limbs), presence of a markedly distended urinary bladder and absence of hydrops, pterygia and bone fractures. Other craniofacial (e.g. cleft palate, facial palsy) and ocular (e.g. anisocoria, retinal detachment) anomalies may be additionally observed. The disease is usually neonatally lethal however, survival into adolescence has been reported.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
